Statute Of Limitations.definition: a statute establishing a period of time from the accrual of a cause of action

1 a.definition: a statute establishing a period of time from the accrual of a cause of action (as upon the occurrence or discovery of an injury) within which a right of action must be exercised compare,

sub_terms.b: a criminal statute establishing the period of time within which an offense can be punished after its commission

2.definition: a period of time established by a statute of limitations for commencing an action or prosecution

3.definition: an affirmative defense that the statute of limitations has expired
